summary: This bill, the "Tim Hart Wildland Firefighter Classification and Pay Parity Act," aims to improve the pay, benefits, and working conditions of federal wildland firefighters. It establishes special base rates of pay, provides incident response premium pay, rest and recuperation leave, and addresses health concerns like cancer and cardiovascular disease. The bill also includes provisions for retirement, pay parity with structural firefighters, annual pay adjustments, recruitment bonuses, a housing allowance, a career transition program, and a Wildland Fire Management Casualty Assistance Program. Furthermore, it modifies existing laws regarding service accrual for firefighters.
